title: 44 Scotland Street
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: What would it be like to be married to a clever woman like that, he wondered. Could he take her to the taxi-drivers' ball at the Royal Scot Hotel on the Glasgow Road? Hardly.

title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He was a great character. He wore an old army helmet and used to say to everybody that he had just come in off the Glasgow Road and could one spare him the price of a cup of tea.'

title: Filth
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: The wig. It cost two hundred pounds from Turvey's on the Glasgow Road. Made specially to look like Carole's hair, long and black.

title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Beggars used to be old and crabbit, remember? There was that man whom everybody called the Glasgow Road Tramp. He was a great character.
